medium: Mahogany, ivory, pigment, gilt, and metal works
title: Harp
description: vertical pillar finely carved and terminating in female caryatid; the curved neck has an open face paneled in glass, exposing the comb containing the mechanism for strings and also the signature of the maker in brass; the body of mahogany is paneled on one side with bands of ivory in the center, and the opposite side is painted with landscape scenes; near the top is a drapery on which is also painted the signature of the maker; the pedestal box is carved and gilded and sets on an octagonal wooden box of a later maker
creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell in memory of James S. and Sallie M. Bell
